p: Following the report of a pneumonia outbreak in late December 2019 ( WHO 2020), the first severe acute respiratory syndrome-coronavirus-2 (SARS-CoV-2) genome sequence was made publicly available on the 10 January 2020. Real time sequencing of viral genomes can help to understand the transmission history of pandemics and provide insights into how the pathogen is evolving ( Gardy and Loman 2018). Additionally, dynamic nomenclature systems, as has been proposed for CoV disease-2019 (COVID-19; Rambaut etÂ al. 2020), can be useful for tracking purposes.
